lines.text: I've certainly got to hand it to you, Ollie.
For what?
Well for the meticulous care with which you have executed your finely formulated machinations in extricating us from this devastating dilemma.
[Ollie looks at the camera, unamused]
Then, on the other hand...
Get in bed.
What?
Get in bed. "Meticulous." Hmph.
Well, here's another nice mess you've gotten me into.
Now why did you hire a veterinarian?
I didn't think his religion would make any difference.
I'll show you, you Son of a Desert! Go to a convention on me, ha! ha!
[last lines]

[sings]
Hololulu baby, won't you close those eyes.
[a pot is hurled at his head]
Now isn't this nice?
It sure is. We're just like two peas in a pot.
To catch a Hardy they've got to get up very early in the morning.
What time?
Oh about half past - "What time." Hmph.
Where is she?
Maybe she went to the mountains.
I'll bet she did. You know she makes me sick.
Well if she didn't go to the mountains, then Mohammad would have to come here.
Have you anything else to say?
Why no. That's all there is. There isn't anymore. Is there Stanley?
No, that's our story and we're stuck with it. In it.
You'd better take my temperature.
[pointing]
Get that thermometer.
The what?
Thermometer! You'll find it on the shelf.
[groaning]
Ooh... ooh... ooh.

[as Stan puts it in his mouth]
Uh-um.

[after Stan has taken his pulse]
What does it say?
Wet and windy.
[on the telephone]
Charley tells me you're from Los Angeles. What part?
All of me.
If you don't be careful, she's going to get the upper hand of you.
Stanley, is Oliver telling the truth?
Go ahead and tell her.
[He mimes smoking a cigarette]
Is he?

[cries]
No, we didn't go to Honolulu, we went to the convention...
[cries overtake his dialog... Oliver stares at the camera]
That settles it! I'm not goin' to Honolulu!

[angrily]
Oh, yes, you ARE going to Honolulu if you have to go alone!
If I have to go to Honolulu alone,
[points to Stan]
he's going with me!

[after the boys have rung the bell one time too many]
What d'ya think this is? Halloween?
[to Ollie]
Come in, you bad boy!
Do you have to ask your wife everything?
If I didn't ask her, I wouldn't know what she wanted me to do.
What did Betty say?
Betty said that honesty was the best politics.
Why didn't you want to take the oath?
I was afraid.
Of what?

I was afraid that if I took the oath, that my wife wouldn't let me go. And the Exhausted Ruler said that if... you took an oath, it would have to be broken for... generations and... centuries of... hundreds of years and my wife would let...
Do you have to ask your wife everything?
Well if I didn't ask her, I wouldn't know what she wanted me to do.
Why don't you pattern your life after mine? I go places and do things and *then* tell my wife. Every man should be the king in his own castle.
I go places and do things, and then *then* tell my wife.
Stanley wouldn't dare lie to me. I hate to think what would happen if he ever did.

I may not be king of my castle, but I certainly wouldn't allow my wife to wear any pants. I'd like to see my old woman throwing things. It's disgraceful. Never heard of such goings off. On. If my old ball and chain ever talked to me... If she even dared... You know what I'd say?
What?
I'd say...
[Sees Betty]
Hello, honey. I...
[Double takes]
What seems to be the trouble?
I think he's suffering from a nervous shakedown.
I haven't heard from you since you sang in the choir.
And you used to pump the organ, remember? You little old organ pumper, you!
Never mind what she said. What did Betty say?
Honesty is the best politics.

[Sarcastically]
So Stanley wouldn't *dare* lie to *you*...
Well, he never has before.

[Standing and yelling at the screen as she sees Ollie in the newsreel]
You wait till you get home, you big overstuffed...
Hey, sit down!
You shut up... come on, Betty
